text: Sixto Serrano Brillantes, Jr. (August 14, 1939 â€“ August 11, 2020) was a Filipino election lawyer. He was the chairman of the Commission on Elections from 2011 to 2015. He was appointed by President Benigno Aquino III on January 16, 2011. He was born in Manila. On July 25, 2020 he was diagnosed with COVID-19 and was hospitalized in Manila. He died from the infection on August 11, 2020 at the age of 80.Ex-poll chief Brillantes dies after bout with COVID-19 ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Manila Category:Lawyers from Manila
title: Sixto Brillantes
